column4: Will software for one linux distro work for another or are they all different in what will run?
Recompiling software properly is not easy :(  You have to hope someone else has it properly set up/compiled/packaged for your distro already.

Yeah, the differences between distributions like RedHat versus Ubuntu are large.  However, ubuntu and kubuntu are both built on the "ubuntu base", thus making them and their packages nearly exactly the same.  kubuntu just puts a different face on the GUI.
